awd_titl_txt: Presidential Young Investigator Award:  Theoretical High    Energy Physics
awd_abstract_narration: Theoretical research on the interface of particle physics               and cosmology will be performed over the next five years.                       Models of particle physics attempting to unify the four                         fundamental forces necessarily involve energies inaccessible to                 present day accelerators.  In the standard Big Bang model of                    the early universe, however, extremely high temperatures and                    densities are present and lend a background for testing unified                 models. Necessary observational consequences of a unified                       theory should include, for example, a matter-antimatter                         asymmetry and the correct abundances of light nuclear isotopes.                 The resulting goal of such a program is thus to further our                     understanding of the forces of nature as well as the                            evolutionary history of the Universe.                                                   The work will be carried out by a highly-distinguished                  young physicist who is one of the new Presidential Young                        Investigators for 1987.
